@graph.name: Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Pumpkin cinnamon rolls are soft, gooey & delicious. Made with pumpkin puree, cozy fall spices and topped with a spiced cream cheese frosting.

itemListElement.name: Home
Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls

@graph.name: Can you bake pumpkin cinnamon rolls from frozen?

acceptedAnswer.text: I don't recommend baking them from frozen, because the rolls need to rise after being assembled before being baked. Although they do rise in the oven.
Yes, you can double this recipe and bake the rolls on a large jelly roll pan.
You can use pureed sweet potato or butternut squash in place of the pumpkin.

@graph.name: Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls Recipe
@graph.description: These pumpkin cinnamon rolls are soft, gooey and delicious. Made with pumpkin puree, cozy fall spices and topped with a spiced cream cheese frosting – they’re a perfect fall breakfast.

video.name: Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls
video.description: These pumpkin cinnamon rolls are soft, gooey and delicious. Made with pumpkin puree, cozy fall spices and topped with a spiced cream cheese frosting – they’re a perfect fall breakfast.

recipeIngredient: ½ cup whole milk (warm (105 degrees F))

recipeInstructions.name: Make the Pumpkin Cinnamon Roll Dough:

itemListElement.text: Warm milk in the microwave milk for 15-30 seconds. It should be warm but not hot to the touch (about 105 degrees F).
itemListElement.name: Warm milk in the microwave milk for 15-30 seconds. It should be warm but not hot to the touch (about 105 degrees F).

itemListElement.text: Place milk into the bowl of your standing mixer, then add 1 TBS sugar and yeast to the warm milk. Stir and let it sit (proof) for five minutes or until it becomes foamy.
itemListElement.name: Place milk into the bowl of your standing mixer, then add 1 TBS sugar and yeast to the warm milk. Stir and let it sit (proof) for five minutes or until it becomes foamy.

itemListElement.text: Add ¼ cup sugar, melted butter, pumpkin puree, egg, and vanilla to the mixture in the bowl of your standing mixer. Use a dough hook to stir until combined
itemListElement.name: Add ¼ cup sugar, melted butter, pumpkin puree, egg, and vanilla to the mixture in the bowl of your standing mixer. Use a dough hook to stir until combined

itemListElement.text: Add 2 cups flour, salt, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice and stir the dough hook, starting on low and increasing to high.
itemListElement.name: Add 2 cups flour, salt, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice and stir the dough hook, starting on low and increasing to high.

itemListElement.text: Add more flour ¼ cup at a time until a smooth ball is formed. The dough should be smooth and only slightly tacky to the touch.
itemListElement.name: Add more flour ¼ cup at a time until a smooth ball is formed. The dough should be smooth and only slightly tacky to the touch.

itemListElement.text: Knead dough in the standing mixer until a large ball is formed.
itemListElement.name: Knead dough in the standing mixer until a large ball is formed.

itemListElement.text: Transfer dough to a floured surface and knead with your hands until it is smooth and elastic (about 3-5 minutes). Form it into a ball.
itemListElement.name: Transfer dough to a floured surface and knead with your hands until it is smooth and elastic (about 3-5 minutes). Form it into a ball.

itemListElement.text: Grease a large bowl and place the dough inside.
itemListElement.name: Grease a large bowl and place the dough inside.

itemListElement.text: Cover the bowl with a warm, damp towel and put the bowl in a warm place to rise for 1 hour or until dough has doubled in size.
itemListElement.name: Cover the bowl with a warm, damp towel and put the bowl in a warm place to rise for 1 hour or until dough has doubled in size.

itemListElement.text: While the dough is rising, make the filing. Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl. Then melt the butter and set aside (It will be brushed on the dough later).
itemListElement.name: While the dough is rising, make the filing. Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl. Then melt the butter and set aside (It will be brushed on the dough later).

itemListElement.text: Alternately, you can combine butter, brown sugar, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice until mixture is homogenous (uniform throughout).  Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Alternately, you can combine butter, brown sugar, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice until mixture is homogenous (uniform throughout).  Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle a large work surface with flour.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle a large work surface with flour.

itemListElement.text: Gently press the gas out of the dough and form it into a rectangle.
itemListElement.name: Gently press the gas out of the dough and form it into a rectangle.

itemListElement.text: Roll the dough into a rectangle that’s 18” long and 8” wide (18x8”), and about ¼ inch thick.
itemListElement.name: Roll the dough into a rectangle that’s 18” long and 8” wide (18x8”), and about ¼ inch thick.

itemListElement.text: Either: 1) Use a pastry brush to spread the melted butter all over the dough. Then sprinkle the dough with cinnamon sugar mixture and pat it down gently to insure it sticks. Or 2) Spread the filling over the dough using greased hands or a greased spatula. This process can seem difficult but it gets easier as you spread it.
itemListElement.name: Either: 1) Use a pastry brush to spread the melted butter all over the dough. Then sprinkle the dough with cinnamon sugar mixture and pat it down gently to insure it sticks. Or 2) Spread the filling over the dough using greased hands or a greased spatula. This process can seem difficult but it gets easier as you spread it.

itemListElement.text: Tightly roll the dough and cut into 9 equal sized rolls (I recommend measuring by placing a tape measure next to the rolled dough to ensure it’s 18” long, then make marks every 2 inches and cut the rolls to be 2” wide).
itemListElement.name: Tightly roll the dough and cut into 9 equal sized rolls (I recommend measuring by placing a tape measure next to the rolled dough to ensure it’s 18” long, then make marks every 2 inches and cut the rolls to be 2” wide).

itemListElement.text: Line an 8x8” or 9x9” baking dish with parchment paper and lightly grease. Then place rolls in 3 rows of 3, evenly spaced.
itemListElement.name: Line an 8x8” or 9x9” baking dish with parchment paper and lightly grease. Then place rolls in 3 rows of 3, evenly spaced.

itemListElement.text: Cover and let rise until nearly doubled, about 30-60 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Cover and let rise until nearly doubled, about 30-60 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.

itemListElement.text: Once rolls are doubled in size, bake them in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 25-30 minutes. They will rise more in the oven.
itemListElement.name: Once rolls are doubled in size, bake them in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 25-30 minutes. They will rise more in the oven.

itemListElement.text: While rolls are baking, beat together cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla extract and salt until smooth. Do NOT chill the frosting. Keep it at room temperature until the cinnamon rolls are baked.
itemListElement.name: While rolls are baking, beat together cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla extract and salt until smooth. Do NOT chill the frosting. Keep it at room temperature until the cinnamon rolls are baked.

itemListElement.text: Once the cinnamon rolls have bene removed from the oven, spread the cream cheese frosting on them while they are still warm.
itemListElement.name: Once the cinnamon rolls have bene removed from the oven, spread the cream cheese frosting on them while they are still warm.

itemListElement.text: Cool & Serve!
itemListElement.name: Cool & Serve!

itemListElement.text: Let cool slightly and serve warm.
itemListElement.name: Let cool slightly and serve warm.
